ground_truth: Eddie walks over to the water cooler, and his face is buried in his lap as Charlie massages his back. Behind him, in the washroom, is Fats, washing his face and hands. Charlie gets Eddie a bottle, while Bert and Henry watch Eddie coldly. A drunken, exhausted Eddie nods, looks up at Bert, grins maliciously, and takes a drink. Charlie starts to put away Eddie’s cue stick. Fats emerges from the washroom, dries his hands, and looks at Eddie and then at Bert, who nods. Henry helps Fats into the jacket with the carnation still in the lapel, and Eddie grins at this. So does Bert. Fats opens his palms for the sprinkling of the talcum powder, rubs his hands together, then takes out his cigarette case. Bert smiles in appreciation. Eddie grabs the leather case out of Charlie’s hands, rises, and confronts Fats almost scornfully, then looks down at his own dirty, disheveled shirt. He and a smiling Bert exchange glances as Eddie moves to put on his jacket. Charlie confronts him, and Eddie puts a bottle into the pocket of his jacket and returns to the table to screw together his cue stick. The sight of Fats makes him laugh again, and everyone stares at Eddie as he scratches his head, alone with his private joke. Eddie abruptly tosses his cue case away, and a worried Charlie picks up the case and stands by mutely, watching Eddie disintegrate. Eddie leans over to shoot, then turns away, laughing loudly to himself, while Fats watches him soberly, patiently. From a high angle, Fats is shooting, and Eddie is asleep on a stool against a wall, with even Bert dozing. The shots go in, and Eddie bangs his head against the wall, knocking over a bottle as he tries to get up off the stool. The noise startles him, and Charlie watches sadly. Eddie gropes through his pockets and comes up with a few crumpled bills. Fats rises and tosses his cue on the table, and Willie gives him the stake money. Fats confronts Eddie, steps by him, and heads for the coat rack, slapping the stake money into Bert’s hand as he goes by. Bert returns the money to his billfold, wordlessly. The blinds are drawn and the light strikes Eddie in the eyes, but still he stumbles after Fats, holding his money out before him, pleading. He bangs against the corner of the table and falls onto the floor. Fats hears him go down and pauses, turning to see Charlie rush to Eddie’s side. After a moment, Fats continues on toward the door. Charlie slaps Eddie’s cheeks as Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach step around the body on their way out. Eddie is lying on his bed staring at the ceiling, the crashing of pool balls sounding in his head.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Eddie strides over to the water dispenser, and his visage is hidden in his lap as Charlie kneads his back. Behind him, in the restroom, is Fats, cleaning his face and hands. Charlie obtains Eddie a bottle, while Bert and Henry observe Eddie icily. A intoxicated, fatigued Eddie nods, gazes up at Bert, smirks malevolently, and takes a sip. Charlie begins to store Eddie’s cue stick. Fats exits from the restroom, dries his hands, and glances at Eddie and then at Bert, who nods. Henry assists Fats into the coat with the carnation still in the lapel, and Eddie smirks at this. So does Bert. Fats opens his palms for the sprinkling of the talcum powder, rubs his hands together, then extracts his cigarette case. Bert grins in appreciation. Eddie snatches the leather case out of Charlie’s hands, rises, and faces Fats almost disdainfully, then looks down at his own grimy, rumpled shirt. He and a smiling Bert swap glances as Eddie moves to don his coat. Charlie confronts him, and Eddie slips a bottle into the pocket of his coat and returns to the table to screw together his cue stick. The sight of Fats makes him chuckle again, and everyone gazes at Eddie as he scratches his head, alone with his private humor. Eddie suddenly hurls his cue case away, and a concerned Charlie retrieves the case and stands by silently, observing Eddie crumble. Eddie bends over to shoot, then turns away, laughing loudly to himself, while Fats observes him soberly, patiently. From a high angle, Fats is shooting, and Eddie is asleep on a stool against a wall, with even Bert dozing. The shots go in, and Eddie bangs his head against the wall, toppling a bottle as he attempts to rise from the stool. The clamor startles him, and Charlie watches mournfully. Eddie searches through his pockets and produces a few crumpled notes. Fats rises and tosses his cue on the table, and Willie hands him the stake money. Fats faces Eddie, steps by him, and heads for the coat rack, slapping the stake money into Bert’s hand as he passes by. Bert returns the money to his wallet, wordlessly. The blinds are drawn and the light hits Eddie in the eyes, but still he stumbles after Fats, holding his money out before him, begging. He collides with the corner of the table and falls onto the ground. Fats hears him go down and pauses, turning to see Charlie rush to Eddie’s side. After a moment, Fats continues on toward the door. Charlie slaps Eddie’s cheeks as Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach step around the figure on their way out. Eddie is lying on his bed staring at the ceiling, the crashing of pool balls echoing in his mind.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Eddie walks over to the water cooler, and his face is buried in his lap as Charlie massages his back. Behind him, in the washroom, Fats is washing his face and hands. A bottle is gotten for Eddie by Charlie, while Eddie is watched coldly by Bert and Henry. A drunken, exhausted Eddie nods, looks up at Bert, grins maliciously, and takes a drink. Eddie’s cue stick is started to be put away by Charlie. Fats emerges from the washroom, dries his hands, and looks at Eddie and then at Bert, who nods. Fats is helped into the jacket with the carnation still in the lapel by Henry, and this is grinned at by Eddie. So does Bert. Fats opens his palms for the sprinkling of the talcum powder, rubs his hands together, then takes out his cigarette case. Bert appreciates this and smiles. The leather case is grabbed by Eddie out of Charlie’s hands, he rises and almost scornfully confronts Fats, then looks down at his own dirty, disheveled shirt. A glances exchange is shared between him and a smiling Bert as Eddie moves to put on his jacket. Charlie confronts him, and a bottle is put into the pocket of his jacket by Eddie, who then returns to the table to screw together his cue stick. The sight of Fats makes him laugh again, and at Eddie, everyone stares as he scratches his head, alone with his private joke. His cue case is abruptly tossed away by Eddie, and the case is picked up by a worried Charlie, who stands by mutely, watching Eddie disintegrate. Eddie leans over to shoot, then turns away, laughing loudly to himself, while Fats watches him soberly, patiently. Fats is shooting from a high angle, and Eddie is asleep on a stool against a wall, with even Bert dozing. The shots go in, and his head is banged against the wall by Eddie, knocking over a bottle as he tries to get up off the stool. The noise startles him, and Charlie watches sadly. Through his pockets, Eddie gropes and comes up with a few crumpled bills. Fats rises and tosses his cue on the table, and Willie gives him the stake money. Eddie is confronted by Fats, who steps by him and heads for the coat rack, slapping the stake money into Bert’s hand as he goes by. The money is returned to his billfold by Bert, wordlessly. The blinds are drawn, and Eddie is struck in the eyes by the light, but still, after Fats, he stumbles, holding his money out before him, pleading. He bangs against the corner of the table and falls onto the floor. Fats hears him go down and pauses, turning to see Charlie rush to Eddie’s side. After a moment, Fats continues on toward the door. Eddie’s cheeks are slapped by Charlie as, on their way out, Sausage, Willie, and Preach, along with Bert, step around the body. Eddie is lying on his bed, staring at the ceiling, the crashing of pool balls sounding in his head.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Eddie, face buried, approaches the water cooler as Charlie massages his back. In the washroom, Fats washes up. Charlie hands Eddie a bottle while Bert and Henry observe him coldly. Eddie nods, grins at Bert, and drinks. Charlie starts to store Eddie’s cue stick. Fats, drying his hands, looks at Eddie and Bert, who nods. Henry helps Fats into his jacket with the carnation, prompting grins from Eddie and Bert. Fats applies talcum powder, then takes out his cigarette case. Bert smiles approvingly. Eddie grabs Charlie’s leather case, confronts Fats, glances at his own disheveled shirt, then exchanges looks with Bert before donning his jacket. Eddie puts a bottle in his pocket, assembles his cue stick, and laughs at Fats, drawing everyone’s gaze. He tosses his cue case away, leaving concerned Charlie to retrieve it and watch Eddie unravel. Eddie leans to shoot but turns away, laughing, with Fats watching soberly. From above, Fats shoots as Eddie sleeps on a stool, even Bert dozing. Shots sink in; Eddie hits his head, knocking over a bottle, stirring Charlie. Eddie finds a few crumpled bills in his pockets. Fats rises, tosses his cue, and Willie hands him the stake money, which Fats passes to Bert without words. With blinds drawn, light hits Eddie’s eyes, yet he stumbles after Fats, offering money. He hits the table corner and falls. Fats hears, pauses, sees Charlie rush to Eddie, then continues to the door. As Charlie slaps Eddie’s cheeks, Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach step around Eddie’s body, leaving him on his bed, hearing pool balls crash in his head.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Eddie, with his head down, is comforted by Charlie at the water cooler. In the washroom, Fats washes up. Charlie hands Eddie a bottle as Bert and Henry watch coldly. Eddie, drunk and tired, grins at Bert and drinks. Charlie stores Eddie’s cue stick. Fats emerges, dries his hands, nods to Bert, and dons his jacket with Henry’s help, both grinning. Fats applies talcum powder and retrieves his cigarette case, impressing Bert. Eddie—holding a leather case—scornfully confronts Fats, then looks at his own messy shirt. He exchanges glances with Bert and dons his jacket, placing a bottle inside. Charlie challenges him, but Eddie returns to assemble his cue stick, laughing at the sight of Fats. Eddie throws his cue case away, leaving Charlie concerned as Eddie deteriorates. Eddie tries to shoot, laughs to himself, and Fats watches patiently. Fats takes a shot while Eddie, asleep on a stool, suddenly bangs his head against the wall, startling himself and Charlie. Eddie finds some crumpled bills as Fats collects his stake money and leaves it with Bert. Bert silently puts it away. Eddie, struck by light through closed blinds, stumbles after Fats, holding his money and pleading, but falls. Fats notices and sees Charlie help Eddie. Fats leaves as others step around Eddie. Eddie lies on his bed, haunted by the sound of pool balls.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Eddie, with a weary gait, makes his way over to the water cooler, his face almost hidden, resting in the comfort of his lap, as Charlie carefully massages his tired back. Behind this scene, within the confines of the washroom, Fats is present, meticulously washing his face and hands with deliberate care. Charlie, showing his attentive nature, retrieves a bottle for Eddie, while both Bert and Henry stand by, their gazes fixed on Eddie with a cold, unyielding intensity. In a drunken stupor, Eddie, exhausted from the ordeal, acknowledges them with a nod, then looks upwards at Bert with a grin that can only be described as malicious before taking a swig from the bottle. 

In the background, ever efficient, Charlie begins the task of putting away Eddie’s cue stick. Fats reemerges from the washroom, methodically drying his hands, and he casts a glance first at Eddie, then at Bert, who acknowledges him with a nod. In a display of camaraderie, Henry assists Fats into his jacket, the carnation prominently displayed in the lapel, which elicits a grin from Eddie, mirrored by Bert. Fats, with a sense of ritual, opens his palms for the talcum powder, rubs his hands together, and retrieves his cigarette case with practiced ease. Bert nods appreciatively, his smile lingering.

Eddie, with sudden determination, snatches the leather case from Charlie’s grasp, stands up, and confronts Fats with an almost disdainful air, glancing down at the state of his own dirty, disheveled shirt. In a moment of shared understanding, he exchanges a knowing look with the smiling Bert before proceeding to put on his jacket. Charlie confronts Eddie, but Eddie, unperturbed, slips a bottle into his jacket pocket and strides back to the table, methodically assembling his cue stick. The sight of Fats amuses him, causing him to laugh once more, and everyone’s attention turns to him as he stands there, scratching his head, indulging in some private, inscrutable joke.

With a sudden gesture, Eddie tosses his cue case aside, an action that prompts a worried Charlie to retrieve it, standing quietly by as he watches Eddie’s composure crumble. Eddie leans over to take a shot, but then turns away abruptly, his laughter echoing loudly, while Fats observes him soberly and patiently. From a vantage point high above, Fats is seen taking his shots with precision, whereas Eddie, succumbing to exhaustion, is slumped on a stool against the wall, with even Bert appearing to doze off. The shots find their mark, and in his stupor, Eddie bangs his head against the wall, the jolt causing a bottle to topple as he clumsily attempts to rise from the stool. The clatter startles him, and Charlie looks on with a sense of sadness.

Eddie, in search of some semblance of worth, rummages through his pockets and retrieves a few crumpled bills. Fats stands and tosses his cue onto the table with finality, as Willie hands over the stake money. Fats confronts Eddie momentarily, then steps around him and makes his way toward the coat rack, handing the stake money to Bert with a casual slap as he passes. Bert, without uttering a word, returns the money to his billfold. The blinds are drawn, allowing light to strike Eddie’s eyes, yet undeterred, he stumbles after Fats, his money held out in front of him in a pleading gesture. He collides with the corner of the table and collapses to the floor.

Fats, hearing the commotion, pauses and turns, observing as Charlie rushes to Eddie’s side. A moment passes, and Fats resumes his path toward the door. Charlie endeavors to revive Eddie by slapping his cheeks gently, as Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach navigate around Eddie’s prone form on their way out. Finally, Eddie finds himself lying on his bed, eyes fixed on the ceiling, the reverberating crash of pool balls echoing hauntingly in his mind.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Eddie, moving with a weary and sluggish gait, slowly makes his way over to the water cooler. His face is almost completely hidden as it rests in the comforting embrace of his lap, while Charlie, with care and attention, gently massages Eddie's tired and aching back. In the background of this scene, within the confines of the small washroom, Fats can be found, meticulously and methodically washing his face and hands with deliberate care and precision. Charlie, ever attentive to the needs of those around him, retrieves a bottle for Eddie. Meanwhile, both Bert and Henry stand nearby, their gazes unwavering and fixed on Eddie with a cold, unyielding intensity. Eddie, caught in the throes of a drunken stupor and exhausted from the ordeal he has faced, acknowledges them with a nod. He then looks upwards at Bert, a grin spreading across his face—a grin that can only be described as malicious—before he takes a swig from the bottle.

In the background, efficiently going about his tasks, Charlie begins the process of putting away Eddie’s cue stick. Fats emerges from the washroom, drying his hands in a methodical manner. He casts a glance first at Eddie and then at Bert, who acknowledges him with a nod. In a gesture that speaks of camaraderie, Henry assists Fats into his jacket, the bright carnation prominently displayed in the lapel, which brings a grin to Eddie's face, mirrored by Bert. Fats, as if performing a ritual, opens his palms for the talcum powder, rubs his hands together, and retrieves his cigarette case with practiced ease. Bert nods appreciatively, his smile lingering on his face.

Eddie, with a sudden burst of determination, snatches the leather case from Charlie’s grasp. He stands up with an air of confrontation directed at Fats, glancing disdainfully down at the state of his own dirty and disheveled shirt. In an instant of shared understanding, he exchanges a knowing look with the ever-smiling Bert before proceeding to put on his jacket. Charlie, feeling compelled to confront Eddie, does so, but Eddie, remaining utterly unperturbed, slips a bottle into his jacket pocket and strides back toward the table, where he methodically assembles his cue stick. The sight of Fats amuses him greatly, causing him to laugh once more, and collectively everyone's attention turns to him as he stands there, scratching his head, indulging in some private, inscrutable joke.

With a sudden and unexpected gesture, Eddie tosses his cue case aside, an action that prompts the worried Charlie to quickly retrieve it. Charlie stands quietly by, observing as he watches Eddie’s composure begin to crumble. Eddie leans over to take a shot but then turns away abruptly, his laughter resonating loudly throughout the room, while Fats observes him with a sober and patient demeanor. From a vantage point high above, Fats is seen taking his shots with meticulous precision, whereas Eddie, overwhelmed by exhaustion, finds himself slumped on a stool against the wall, with even Bert appearing to doze off. The sound of the shots finding their mark echoes, and in his stupor, Eddie bangs his head against the wall, the jolt causing a bottle to topple as he clumsily attempts to rise from the stool. The unexpected clatter startles him, and Charlie looks on with a profound sense of sadness.

Eddie, in search of some semblance of worth, rummages through his pockets and retrieves a few crumpled bills. Fats stands, tossing his cue onto the table with a sense of finality, as Willie hands over the stake money. Fats confronts Eddie momentarily, then steps around him, making his way toward the coat rack, handing the stake money to Bert with a casual slap as he passes by. Bert, without uttering a single word, returns the money to his billfold. The blinds are drawn, allowing the light to strike directly into Eddie’s eyes, yet undeterred, he stumbles after Fats, holding his money out in front of him in a pleading gesture. He accidentally collides with the corner of the table and collapses to the floor.

Fats, hearing the commotion behind him, pauses and turns to observe the scene as Charlie rushes to Eddie’s side. A moment of hesitation passes, and Fats resumes his path toward the door. Charlie endeavors to revive Eddie by gently slapping his cheeks, while Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach navigate around Eddie’s prone form on their way out. Eventually, Eddie finds himself lying on his bed, his eyes fixed intently on the ceiling, the haunting reverberation of pool balls crashing echoing persistently in his mind.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Eddie slowly makes his way to the water cooler, his body heavy with fatigue, and as he leans forward, his face buried in his lap, Charlie’s hands soothe Eddie’s aching back with a gentle massage. Meanwhile, in the background, the washroom door remains slightly ajar, revealing Fats as he meticulously washes his face and hands, the water running softly. Charlie, attentive to Eddie's needs, retrieves a water bottle for him, while Bert and Henry stand to the side, their gazes cold and unyielding as they observe Eddie’s weary demeanor. A drunken and exhausted Eddie acknowledges the scene with a nod, lifting his head to meet Bert's eyes and offering a malicious grin before taking a swig from the bottle. As Eddie drinks, Charlie begins to tidy up by putting away Eddie’s cue stick, signaling the end of one chapter. Fats steps out of the washroom, the subtle sound of drying cloth against skin as he uses a towel to dry his hands. His gaze moves from Eddie to Bert, who gives a slight nod, acknowledging the silent communication between them. Henry steps forward to assist Fats in slipping into his jacket, the carnation prominently displayed in the lapel as Eddie observes with a grin, mirroring Bert's amusement. Fats then prepares for action, opening his palms to receive the light dusting of talcum powder, rubbing it in with methodical precision before reaching for his cigarette case, an act that draws a smile of appreciation from Bert. In a sudden burst of energy, Eddie snatches the leather case from Charlie’s grasp, rising to face Fats with an almost scornful air. He glances down, self-conscious of his own dirty and disheveled shirt, then glances at Bert, sharing a moment of mutual understanding. Eddie slips on his jacket and Charlie approaches, confronting him silently. Eddie casually slips the bottle into his jacket pocket and strides back to the table, where he begins to screw his cue stick together with determination. The sight of Fats again brings a chuckle to Eddie, a sound that fills the room as everyone's attention turns to him. Eddie scratches his head, seemingly lost in a private joke, and suddenly, with a burst of impulsive energy, he tosses his cue case aside. Charlie, a silent observer of Eddie’s unraveling, dutifully retrieves the case and stands by, his concern etched in silence. Eddie leans forward to take a shot, but abruptly pulls back, his laughter echoing through the room, while Fats remains on the other side, watching patiently with a sober expression. From a high angle, the camera captures Fats shooting confidently as Eddie slumps asleep on a stool against the wall, even as Bert nods off. As the shots successfully land, Eddie jolts awake, his head banging against the wall, knocking over a bottle in his startled attempt to rise from the stool. The clatter brings him back to awareness, with Charlie gazing on sadly. Eddie fumbles through his pockets, coming up with crumpled bills, a meager display of his current state. Nearby, Fats rises, confidently tosses his cue onto the table, and Willie hands him the stake money. Fats steps by Eddie without a word, heading towards the coat rack, casually slapping the stake money into Bert’s waiting hand. Bert silently tucks the money back into his billfold. As the blinds are drawn, the harsh light pierces Eddie’s eyes, yet he stumbles forward, clutching his money desperately in front of him, his pleas falling on deaf ears. In his haste, he collides with the corner of the table and tumbles to the floor. The noise reaches Fats, who pauses momentarily, turning back to watch as Charlie rushes to Eddie’s side. After a brief hesitation, Fats resumes his exit towards the door, leaving the scene behind. Charlie tends to Eddie with urgency, slapping his cheeks in an attempt to revive him as Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach step around Eddie's prone form on their way out. Finally, Eddie finds himself lying on his bed, his gaze fixed on the ceiling, where the imaginary sound of crashing pool balls echoes relentlessly in his mind.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Eddie, slumped at the water cooler, receives a back massage from Charlie, while Fats washes up in the nearby washroom. Charlie hands Eddie a bottle as Bert and Henry watch with cold eyes. Drunkenly, Eddie acknowledges them, takes a drink, and grins. Fats emerges, dries off, and nods at Bert, who returns the gesture. As Henry helps Fats with his jacket, both Eddie and Bert grin. Fats applies talcum powder, lights a cigarette, and earns an appreciative smile from Bert. Eddie grabs his cue case from Charlie, confronts Fats scornfully, then glances down at his own disheveled appearance before putting on his jacket. He tucks a bottle in his pocket and assembles his cue stick, chuckling at Fats’ demeanor while everyone watches him. Discarding his cue case, Eddie leans over to shoot, but turns away, laughing to himself, as Fats observes calmly. Eddie dozes off against a wall as Fats takes his shot, waking with a start and knocking over a bottle. He clumsily retrieves some crumpled bills from his pockets. Fats collects his winnings and hands the stake money to Bert, who returns it to his billfold. As daylight floods the room, Eddie, dazed, stumbles after Fats with outstretched money, pleading. He collapses against the table corner, and Fats pauses to see Charlie rush to aid Eddie before proceeding to the door. Charlie tends to Eddie as others step over him, exiting. Eddie is later seen on his bed, lost in thought, with the sound of crashing pool balls echoing in his mind.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Eddie walks over to the water cooler, a relic in the corner of the smoky pool hall, and his face is buried in his lap as Charlie, a friend known for his skillful hands, massages his back. Behind him, in the washroom with its flickering fluorescent light, is Fats, washing his face and hands methodically. Charlie gets Eddie a bottle from the nearby table, while Bert and Henry, both local pool sharks with a reputation for ruthlessness, watch Eddie coldly. A drunken, exhausted Eddie nods, looks up at Bert with the air of someone who knows he's beaten, grins maliciously, and takes a drink. Charlie starts to put away Eddie’s cue stick, the well-worn tool of his trade. Fats emerges from the washroom, dries his hands with an embroidered towel, and looks at Eddie and then at Bert, who nods in silent agreement. Henry helps Fats into the jacket with the carnation still in the lapel, a signature touch known to be his lucky charm, and Eddie grins at this. So does Bert. Fats opens his palms for the sprinkling of the talcum powder, rubs his hands together in a ritualistic manner, then takes out his cigarette case, a silver heirloom inherited from his father. Bert smiles in appreciation of the calm confidence on display. Eddie grabs the leather case out of Charlie’s hands, rises, and confronts Fats almost scornfully, then looks down at his own dirty, disheveled shirt, once crisp and white but now stained with the night’s exertions. He and a smiling Bert exchange glances as Eddie moves to put on his jacket, a battered piece with frayed cuffs. Charlie confronts him, and Eddie puts a bottle of cheap whiskey into the pocket of his jacket and returns to the table to screw together his cue stick, which has seen better days. The sight of Fats makes him laugh again, and everyone stares at Eddie as he scratches his head, alone with his private joke, a memory of past glory or folly. Eddie abruptly tosses his cue case away, and a worried Charlie picks up the case and stands by mutely, watching Eddie disintegrate under the weight of his own demons. Eddie leans over to shoot, then turns away, laughing loudly to himself, while Fats watches him soberly, patiently, like a mentor who’s seen it all before. From a high angle, Fats is shooting with precision, and Eddie is asleep on a stool against a wall, with even Bert dozing in the corner. The shots go in, and Eddie bangs his head against the wall, knocking over a bottle as he tries to get up off the stool in a drunken haze. The noise startles him, and Charlie watches sadly, reflecting on what could have been. Eddie gropes through his pockets and comes up with a few crumpled bills, remnants of his once significant winnings. Fats rises and tosses his cue on the table, and Willie, a long-time observer of these games, gives him the stake money. Fats confronts Eddie, steps by him with the ease of someone who knows the score, and heads for the coat rack, slapping the stake money into Bert’s hand as he goes by. Bert returns the money to his billfold, wordlessly sealing the end of an era. The blinds are drawn, blocking the harsh morning light, and the light strikes Eddie in the eyes, but still he stumbles after Fats, holding his money out before him, pleading with the desperation of someone who’s lost more than just a game. He bangs against the corner of the table and falls onto the floor, the culmination of his downfall. Fats hears him go down and pauses, turning to see Charlie rush to Eddie’s side with a mix of loyalty and pity. After a moment, Fats continues on toward the door, leaving the scene behind. Charlie slaps Eddie’s cheeks as Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach, all silent witnesses to his collapse, step around the body on their way out. Eddie is lying on his bed staring at the ceiling, the crashing of pool balls still sounding in his head like a requiem for his dreams.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Eddie walks over to the water cooler and his face is buried in his lap as Charlie massages his back. Behind him in the washroom is Fats washing his face and hands. Charlie gets Eddie a bottle while Bert and Henry watch Eddie coldly. A drunken exhausted Eddie nods looks up at Bert grins maliciously and takes a drink. Charlie starts to put away Eddie’s cue stick. Fats emerges from the washroom dries his hands and looks at Eddie and then at Bert who nods. Henry helps Fats into the jacket with the carnation still in the lapel and Eddie grins at this. So does Bert. Fats opens his palms for the sprinkling of the talcum powder rubs his hands together then takes out his cigarette case. Bert smiles in appreciation. Eddie grabs the leather case out of Charlie’s hands rises and confronts. Fats almost scornfully then looks down at his own dirty disheveled shirt. He and a smiling Bert exchange glances as Eddie moves to put on his jacket. Charlie confronts him and Eddie puts a bottle into the pocket of his jacket and returns to the table to screw together his cue stick. The sight of Fats makes him laugh again and everyone stares at Eddie as he scratches his head alone with his private joke. Eddie abruptly tosses his cue case away and a worried Charlie picks up the case and stands by mutely watching Eddie disintegrate. Eddie leans over to shoot then turns away laughing loudly to himself while Fats watches him soberly patiently. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. From a high angle. Fats is shooting and Eddie is asleep on a stool against a wall with even Bert dozing. The shots go in and Eddie bangs his head against the wall knocking over a bottle as he tries to get up off the stool. The noise startles him and Charlie watches sadly. Eddie gropes through his pockets and comes up with a few crumpled bills. Fats rises and tosses his cue on the table and Willie gives him the stake money. Fats confronts. Eddie steps by him and heads for the coat rack slapping the stake money into Bert’s hand as he goes by. Bert returns the money to his billfold wordlessly. The blinds are drawn and the light strikes Eddie in the eyes but still he stumbles after Fats holding his money out before him pleading. He bangs against the corner of the table and falls onto the floor. Fats hears him go down and pauses turning to see Charlie rush to Eddie’s side. After a moment Fats continues on toward the door. Charlie slaps Eddie’s cheeks as Bert Sausage. Willie and Preach step around the body on their way out. Eddie is lying on his bed staring at the ceiling. the crashing of pool balls sounding in his head.

In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Charlie gets Eddie a bottle while Bert and Henry watch Eddie coldly. A drunken exhausted Eddie nods looks up at Bert grins maliciously and takes a drink. Willie and Preach step around the body on their way out. Eddie is lying on his bed staring at the ceiling. the crashing of pool balls sounding in his head.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: A giraffe walks over to the water cooler, and its face is buried in its lap as a kangaroo massages its back. Behind the giraffe, in the washroom, is a penguin, washing its face and hands. The kangaroo gets the giraffe a bottle, while a rabbit and a turtle watch the giraffe coldly. A drunken, exhausted giraffe nods, looks up at the rabbit, grins maliciously, and takes a drink. The kangaroo starts to put away the giraffe’s cue stick. The penguin emerges from the washroom, dries its hands, and looks at the giraffe and then at the rabbit, who nods. The turtle helps the penguin into the jacket with the carnation still in the lapel, and the giraffe grins at this. So does the rabbit. The penguin opens its palms for the sprinkling of the talcum powder, rubs its hands together, then takes out its cigarette case. The rabbit smiles in appreciation. The giraffe grabs the leather case out of the kangaroo’s hands, rises, and confronts the penguin almost scornfully, then looks down at its own dirty, disheveled shirt. It and a smiling rabbit exchange glances as the giraffe moves to put on its jacket. The kangaroo confronts it, and the giraffe puts a bottle into the pocket of its jacket and returns to the table to screw together its cue stick. The sight of the penguin makes it laugh again, and everyone stares at the giraffe as it scratches its head, alone with its private joke. The giraffe abruptly tosses its cue case away, and a worried kangaroo picks up the case and stands by mutely, watching the giraffe disintegrate. The giraffe leans over to shoot, then turns away, laughing loudly to itself, while the penguin watches it soberly, patiently. From a high angle, the penguin is shooting, and the giraffe is asleep on a stool against a wall, with even the rabbit dozing. The shots go in, and the giraffe bangs its head against the wall, knocking over a bottle as it tries to get up off the stool. The noise startles it, and the kangaroo watches sadly. The giraffe gropes through its pockets and comes up with a few crumpled bills. The penguin rises and tosses its cue on the table, and a bear gives it the stake money. The penguin confronts the giraffe, steps by it, and heads for the coat rack, slapping the stake money into the rabbit’s hand as it goes by. The rabbit returns the money to its billfold, wordlessly. The blinds are drawn and the light strikes the giraffe in the eyes, but still it stumbles after the penguin, holding its money out before it, pleading. It bangs against the corner of the table and falls onto the floor. The penguin hears it go down and pauses, turning to see the kangaroo rush to the giraffe’s side. After a moment, the penguin continues on toward the door. The kangaroo slaps the giraffe’s cheeks as the rabbit, a fox, the bear, and an owl step around the body on their way out. The giraffe is lying on its bed staring at the ceiling, the crashing of pool balls sounding in its head.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Eddie walks over to the cactus plant, and his face is buried in his elbow as Charlie massages his shoulders. Behind him, in the pantry, is Fats, washing his hair and knees. Charlie gets Eddie a notebook, while Bert and Henry watch Eddie coldly. A drunken, exhausted Eddie nods, looks up at Bert, grins maliciously, and takes a sip. Charlie starts to put away Eddie’s fishing rod. Fats emerges from the pantry, dries his knees, and looks at Eddie and then at Bert, who nods. Henry helps Fats into the jacket with the daffodil still in the pocket, and Eddie grins at this. So does Bert. Fats opens his palms for the sprinkling of the flour, rubs his hands together, then takes out his monocle case. Bert smiles in appreciation. Eddie grabs the canvas backpack out of Charlie’s hands, rises, and confronts Fats almost scornfully, then looks down at his own dirty, disheveled apron. He and a smiling Bert exchange glances as Eddie moves to put on his sweater. Charlie confronts him, and Eddie puts a flashlight into the pocket of his sweater and returns to the table to screw together his fishing rod. The sight of Fats makes him laugh again, and everyone stares at Eddie as he scratches his chin, alone with his private joke. Eddie abruptly tosses his backpack away, and a worried Charlie picks up the backpack and stands by mutely, watching Eddie disintegrate. Eddie leans over to shoot, then turns away, laughing loudly to himself, while Fats watches him soberly, patiently. From a high angle, Fats is shooting, and Eddie is asleep on a hammock against a bookshelf, with even Bert dozing. The shots go in, and Eddie bangs his head against the bookshelf, knocking over a flashlight as he tries to get up off the hammock. The noise startles him, and Charlie watches sadly. Eddie gropes through his pockets and comes up with a few crumpled tickets. Fats rises and tosses his fishing rod on the table, and Willie gives him the ticket stubs. Fats confronts Eddie, steps by him, and heads for the shoe rack, slapping the ticket stubs into Bert’s hand as he goes by. Bert returns the stubs to his wallet, wordlessly. The curtains are drawn and the light strikes Eddie in the eyes, but still he stumbles after Fats, holding his tickets out before him, pleading. He bangs against the corner of the couch and falls onto the floor. Fats hears him go down and pauses, turning to see Charlie rush to Eddie’s side. After a moment, Fats continues on toward the window. Charlie slaps Eddie’s cheeks as Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach step around the body on their way out. Eddie is lying on his mattress staring at the ceiling, the crashing of bowling pins sounding in his head.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Eddie shuffles over to the water cooler, and his face is hidden in his lap as Charlie pats his back. Behind him, in the washroom, is Fats, drying his face and hands. Charlie hands Eddie a bottle, while Bert and Henry gaze at Eddie indifferently. A drunken, exhausted Eddie chuckles, glances up at Bert, smirks playfully, and takes a sip. Charlie starts to pack away Eddie’s cue stick. Fats steps out from the washroom, pats his hands dry, and glances at Eddie and then at Bert, who gestures. Henry assists Fats with putting on the jacket with the carnation still in the lapel, and Eddie chuckles at this. So does Bert. Fats spreads his palms for the sprinkling of the talcum powder, claps his hands together, then takes out his cigarette case. Bert grins in approval. Eddie snatches the leather case from Charlie’s hands, stands, and glances at Fats almost disdainfully, then looks down at his own wrinkled, untidy shirt. He and a grinning Bert exchange looks as Eddie moves to don his jacket. Charlie challenges him, and Eddie slips a bottle into the pocket of his jacket and returns to the table to assemble his cue stick. The sight of Fats makes him laugh again, and everyone gazes at Eddie as he scratches his head, lost in his private amusement. Eddie suddenly flings his cue case aside, and a concerned Charlie retrieves the case and stands silently, observing Eddie unravel. Eddie leans over to aim, then turns away, guffawing to himself, while Fats observes him quietly, patiently. From a high angle, Fats is aiming, and Eddie is napping on a stool against a wall, with even Bert snoozing. The shots sink in, and Eddie bumps his head against the wall, upsetting a bottle as he tries to rise from the stool. The noise surprises him, and Charlie observes sadly. Eddie rummages through his pockets and pulls out a few crumpled bills. Fats stands and throws his cue on the table, and Willie hands him the stake money. Fats approaches Eddie, steps by him, and makes his way to the coat rack, slapping the stake money into Bert’s hand as he passes. Bert places the money back in his billfold, silently. The blinds are lowered, and the light catches Eddie in the eyes, but still he staggers after Fats, holding his money out in front of him, imploring. He bumps against the corner of the table and collapses onto the floor. Fats hears him go down and halts, turning to see Charlie hurry to Eddie’s side. After a moment, Fats resumes heading toward the door. Charlie pats Eddie’s cheeks as Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach step around the body on their way out. Eddie is lying on his bed gazing at the ceiling, the crash of pool balls echoing in his head.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Tony strolls over to the flowerpot, and his elbow is buried in his shoe as Clara massages his toe. Beyond him, in the pantry, is Noodles, washing his elbows and feet. Clara gets Tony a book, while Sam and George watch Tony warmly. A sleepy, delighted Tony nods, gazes up at Sam, smirks playfully, and takes a sip. Clara starts to put away Tony’s umbrella. Noodles emerges from the pantry, dries his feet, and glances at Tony and then at Sam, who nods. George aids Noodles into the sweater with the daisy still in the buttonhole, and Tony smirks at this. So does Sam. Noodles opens his fingers for the sprinkling of the flour, rubs his feet together, then takes out his candy box. Sam grins in admiration. Tony grabs the fabric box out of Clara’s feet, stands, and confronts Noodles almost mockingly, then looks down at his own stained, crumpled trousers. He and a cheerful Sam exchange glances as Tony moves to put on his sweater. Clara confronts him, and Tony puts a book into the pocket of his sweater and returns to the piano to attach together his umbrella. The glimpse of Noodles makes him giggle again, and everyone stares at Tony as he scratches his knee, alone with his private joke. Tony suddenly flings his fabric box away, and a concerned Clara picks up the box and stands by mutely, watching Tony unravel. Tony leans over to whisper, then turns away, chuckling loudly to himself, while Noodles watches him seriously, patiently. From a high ledge, Noodles is whispering, and Tony is asleep on a barrel against a ladder, with even Sam dozing. The whispers go in, and Tony bangs his forehead against the ladder, knocking over a book as he tries to get up off the barrel. The noise surprises him, and Clara watches sadly. Tony fumbles through his shoes and comes up with a few crumpled receipts. Noodles rises and flings his umbrella on the piano, and Moe gives him the prize money. Noodles confronts Tony, steps by him, and heads for the rack of hats, slapping the prize money into Sam’s foot as he goes by. Sam returns the money to his wallet, wordlessly. The curtains are drawn and the light strikes Tony in the ears, but still he stumbles after Noodles, holding his receipts out before him, pleading. He bangs against the edge of the piano and falls onto the carpet. Noodles hears him go down and pauses, turning to see Clara rush to Tony’s side. After a moment, Noodles continues on toward the window. Clara slaps Tony’s knees as Sam, Biscuit, Moe, and Teach step around the blanket on their way out. Tony is lying on his chair staring at the wallpaper, the crashing of chairs sounding in his nose.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Tom ambles over to the vending machine, and his head is nestled in his arms as Max tickles his shoulders. Beside him, in the hallway, is Slim, polishing his shoes and glasses. Max hands Tom a brochure, while Paul and Greg observe Tom silently. A sleepy, weary Tom winks, glances at Paul, smirks mischievously, and unfolds the brochure. Max begins to pack away Tom’s notepad. Slim exits the hallway, pats his glasses, and glances at Tom and then at Paul, who winks. Greg assists Slim into the coat with the lily still on the collar, and Tom smirks at this. So does Paul. Slim stretches his fingers for the application of the hand lotion, claps his palms together, then retrieves his matchbook. Paul smirks in approval. Tom seizes the backpack out of Max’s hands, stands, and challenges Slim almost mockingly, then looks down at his own muddied, crumpled pants. He and a chuckling Paul share a look as Tom proceeds to put on his shoes. Max confronts him, and Tom slides a brochure into the pocket of his shoes and returns to the desk to assemble his notepad. The sight of Slim makes him giggle again, and everyone stares at Tom as he scratches his chin, alone with his inner amusement. Tom suddenly flings his backpack away, and a concerned Max retrieves the backpack and stands by silently, watching Tom unravel. Tom bends over to write, then turns away, chuckling loudly to himself, while Slim observes him calmly, patiently. From a bird's-eye view, Slim is writing, and Tom is napping on a chair against a wall, with even Paul snoozing. The papers get filed, and Tom taps his head against the wall, knocking over a brochure as he attempts to rise from the chair. The racket surprises him, and Max observes sorrowfully. Tom fishes through his pockets and finds a few crumpled receipts. Slim stands and throws his pencil on the desk, and Sam hands him the prize money. Slim confronts Tom, steps past him, and strides toward the coat hook, slapping the prize money into Paul’s hand as he continues on. Paul places the money into his wallet, silently. The curtains are closed and the sunlight hits Tom in the eyes, but still he stumbles after Slim, presenting his money before him, imploring. He bumps into the edge of the desk and lands on the floor. Slim hears him fall and stops, turning to see Max rush to Tom’s aid. After a brief pause, Slim resumes heading for the exit. Max pats Tom’s cheeks as Paul, Pepper, Sam, and Pastor step around the figure on their way out. Tom is resting on his couch gazing at the ceiling, the clattering of typewriter keys echoing in his mind.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Eddie saunters over to the flower vase, and his face is buried in his hands as Charlie tickles his feet. Behind him, in the garage, is Fats, dabbing his shoes and shirt. Charlie hands Eddie a book, while Bert and Henry glare at Eddie cautiously. A sleepy, weary Eddie shakes his head, glances up at Bert, smirks slyly, and bites a sandwich. Charlie begins to hide Eddie’s tennis racket. Fats appears from the garage, polishes his shoes, and gazes at Eddie and then at Bert, who winks. Henry assists Fats into the hat with the feather still in the brim, and Eddie chuckles at this. So does Bert. Fats extends his arms for the sprinkling of glitter, claps his hands together, then pulls out his comb case. Bert chuckles in approval. Eddie snatches the briefcase out of Charlie’s hands, stands, and challenges Fats almost derisively, then examines his own stained, crumpled pants. He and a grinning Bert share a look as Eddie moves to don his vest. Charlie challenges him, and Eddie slips a book into the pocket of his vest and returns to the bench to assemble his tennis racket. The sight of Fats makes him giggle again, and everyone glares at Eddie as he rubs his nose, alone with his private jest. Eddie suddenly flings his racket bag away, and a concerned Charlie retrieves the bag and stands silently, observing Eddie unravel. Eddie bends over to listen, then spins away, chuckling loudly to himself, while Fats observes him seriously, patiently. From a high shelf, Fats is listening, and Eddie is snoozing on a bench against a wall, with even Bert napping. The notes play, and Eddie taps his head against the wall, knocking over a vase as he tries to get up off the bench. The clatter startles him, and Charlie observes sympathetically. Eddie fumbles through his pockets and produces a few torn receipts. Fats stands and flings his racket on the bench, and Willie hands him the token money. Fats faces Eddie, walks by him, and proceeds toward the coat rack, slapping the token money into Bert’s hand as he passes. Bert replaces the money in his wallet, silently. The shades are pulled and the light beams into Eddie’s eyes, but still he stumbles after Fats, holding his money out in front of him, beseeching. He collides with the edge of the bench and collapses onto the floor. Fats hears him fall and halts, turning to see Charlie rush to Eddie’s side. After a pause, Fats resumes heading toward the exit. Charlie pats Eddie’s cheeks as Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach step around the figure on their way out. Eddie is lying on his couch staring at the lamp, the clattering of bowling pins sounding in his mind.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Ricky skips over to the flower vase, and his elbow is wedged in his shoe as Sam tickles his knee. Beside him, in the pantry, is Trixie, dusting her elbows and knees. Sam hands Ricky a lantern, while Greg and Arnold observe Ricky warmly. A sleepy, jubilant Ricky chuckles, glances up at Greg, scowls cheerfully, and sips an apple. Sam begins to toss aside Ricky's fishing rod. Trixie emerges from the pantry, shakes her elbows, and glances at Ricky and then at Greg, who nods. Arnold assists Trixie into the sweater with the tulip still in the cuff, and Ricky frowns at this. So does Greg. Trixie extends her elbows for the dousing of the perfume mist, claps her elbows together, then extracts her whistle case. Greg frowns appreciatively. Ricky snatches the fabric pouch out of Sam’s elbows, leaps, and challenges Trixie almost humbly, then peers at his own spotless, organized blouse. He and a frowning Greg trade looks as Ricky strolls to don his cardigan. Sam challenges him, and Ricky places a lantern into the fold of his cardigan and returns to the picnic to twist together his fishing rod. The presence of Trixie makes him yawn again, and everyone marvels at Ricky as he pats his elbow, engulfed in his personal riddle. Ricky suddenly drops his fishing pouch, and a cheerful Sam retrieves the pouch and lingers silently, studying Ricky evolve. Ricky leans over to paint, then pivots away, yawning loudly to himself, while Trixie studies him sloppily, tirelessly. From a distant perch, Trixie is painting, and Ricky is napping on a stool against a closet, with even Greg lounging. The colors blend in, and Ricky thumps his shoe against the closet, knocking over a lantern as he attempts to stand up from the stool. The clatter alarms him, and Sam observes joyfully. Ricky sifts through his folds and reveals a couple of crinkled feathers. Trixie rises and flings her fishing rod on the bench, and Max hands her the reward feathers. Trixie challenges Ricky, strides by him, and drifts toward the basket hanger, tossing the reward feathers into Greg’s pouch as she passes. Greg returns the feathers to his envelope, silently. The curtains are closed and the shadow strikes Ricky in the teeth, but still he staggers after Trixie, clutching his feathers out ahead of him, requesting. He bumps against the margin of the bench and collapses onto the rug. Trixie hears him tumble and hesitates, pivoting to witness Sam dash to Ricky’s aid. After an instant, Trixie proceeds toward the exit. Sam pats Ricky’s toes as Greg, Button, Max, and Whisper tread around the form on their path out. Ricky is reclining on his hammock gazing at the lamp, the rumbling of marbles echoing in his mind.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Eddie slouches at the water cooler, getting a back massage from Charlie while Fats cleans up in the washroom. Charlie hands Eddie a drink as Bert and Henry observe coldly. Fats returns, and Bert nods to him. Eddie grins and rises contemptuously to face Fats, noting his own disheveled appearance. Smirking at Bert, Eddie puts on his jacket, stows a bottle, and assembles his cue stick. Laughing to himself at Fats's presence, he tosses his cue case aside, prompting a worried Charlie to retrieve it. Eddie takes a shot, then turns away, laughing alone as Fats watches seriously. While Fats shoots, Eddie dozes off on a stool, startling himself awake and knocking over a bottle. He scrambles for his crumpled bills as Fats claims the stake money and exits, ignoring Eddie's pleas. Charlie rushes to a collapsed Eddie, while Bert, Sausage, Willie, and Preach leave. Ultimately, Eddie lies in bed, haunted by the sound of pool balls.
